text: Which of the following is an advantage of multithreading?

options.text: a) Better resource utilization by sharing resources among multiple threads
b) Increased memory requirements for each thread
c) Less complexity in process scheduling
d) Slower execution due to thread synchronization

text: What is a "thread pool"?

options.text: a) A collection of pre-created threads ready to execute tasks
b) A set of resources allocated for a single thread
c) A mechanism for controlling deadlocks
d) A way to increase the number of threads in a process

text: What is the main disadvantage of using a large number of threads in a system?

options.text: a) Increased overhead due to context switching and synchronization
b) More efficient use of memory

text: What is the function of the "join()" method in thread management?

options.text: a) It makes the calling thread wait for the completion of another thread
b) It starts the execution of a thread
c) It terminates a running thread
d) It ensures that threads access shared resources in a safe manner

text: Which of the following is true about "parallelism" in multithreading?

options.text: a) It refers to executing multiple threads concurrently on multiple processors
b) It is the same as concurrency
c) It is limited to single-core processors
d) It eliminates the need for synchronization

text: Which thread scheduling algorithm prioritizes threads based on their importance and deadlines?

In multithreading, what is "context switching"?

options.text: a) Switching between different tasks in a process
b) The process of switching between different threads of the same process
c) Changing the thread execution from one processor to another
d) Assigning new priorities to threads

text: Which of the following is a disadvantage of using threads in an operating system?

options.text: a) Difficulty in sharing resources between threads
b) Increased complexity due to synchronization and context switching
c) Threads are unable to share data
d) Threads are unable to execute concurrently

text: What does "multicore processing" allow in relation to multithreading?

options.text: a) It allows multiple threads to run on different cores concurrently, improving performance
b) It allows threads to run only on a single core
c) It reduces the number of threads created in an application
d) It prevents threads from accessing shared memory

text: Which of the following is an example of a multithreaded application?

options.text: a) A web browser that loads different web pages simultaneously
b) A text editor that edits one document at a time
c) A database management system with no parallel queries
d) A compiler that compiles one source code file sequentially
